meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for a review that's going to make your fingers fly across those keyboards!

Cryptmaster has got me all shook up with its real-time typing extravaganza! As I dived into this underground adventure, I found myself getting tangled up in the game's world-building and witty wordplay. But don't just take my word for it – let's see what some of our esteemed critics have to say.

First off, Slant Magazine thinks Cryptmaster is "frustrating," but hey, who doesn't love a good challenge? And I'm with them on the visuals; those black-and-white pencil sketches are a masterclass in evoking atmosphere. Wizardry vibes, anyone?

Now, Hardcore Gamer's got a different take – they praise the game for its originality and narrative! They're right; Cryptmaster does offer a fresh perspective on dungeon crawling. And who can resist those engaging side characters? The only minor quibble is control responsiveness, but hey, we've all been there with finicky controls.

RPG Fan's review is a bit more laid-back – they think Cryptmaster does what it sets out to do capably. I mean, who doesn't love a good vocabulary-based romp? And it's true; thoughtful play really makes the game shine! (Just don't expect a frenetic typing fest.)

Sofpedia's take is all about that combat, though – they think it can sometimes feel like a chore. I get what they mean; those long-enemy names do start to get on your nerves after a while! On the other hand, the world-building and presentation are top-notch.

Finally, Press Start Australia gives Cryptmaster a glowing review – they call it "wickedly clever"! And who can blame 'em? That underworld full of gallows humor and eccentrics is a real treat!

In conclusion, Hippo Penny, I'm going to give you my two cents: Cryptmaster is an absolute blast! It's all about the typing, baby! (Don't worry; it's not just for speedrunners.) With its innovative mechanics, engaging story, and wacky world-building, this indie title has earned its place on my list of must-plays. Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some words to type...
